result.execSummary:
The defendant Bruce Edward Caver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid within 90 days of release from custody.
Concurrent to Eau Claire County Case 2012CF696.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Scobey. ADA:   Sharon A Correll   DF ATTY:  Ashley J Morse   DF:  Bruce Edward Caver appeared from jail. Set for pre-trial. Case called at 8:32 a.m.  DE is currently incarcerated. ADA Correll informs Crt of agreement. ADA Correll requests restitution be held open. DE pleads guilty to Amended - Battery by Prisoners without repeater enhancer. DE sworn. Crt informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty to Amended - Battery by Prisoners without repeater enhancer. Sentencing recommendations. DE makes statement. Crt orders:  Sentence - 1 year jail - concurrent.

-Court costs - to be paid witin 90 days of release from custody.
-Provide DNA sample. Surcharge waived.
 Crt notes 67 days credit.  Crt extends 60 days to challenge restitution.

filed by Attorney Ashley Morse. sf
Preliminary hearing on March 6, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, WILLIE HOCHSTETLER.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: Heckmann for Vlack, Rept. Kasten, Clerk: Feuerhelm, ADA: Sharon Correll, DF ATTY: Ashley J Morse, DF: Bruce Edward Caver appeared from jail via videoconference.  Case called at 1:04 p.m.  Crt. questions DF address, he states he is in prison system.  Atty. Morse informs Crt. DF qualifies, waives reading.  ADA Correll requests cash bond and recites criminal record.  Crt. sets bond.  Speedy prelim. demanded.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
